conclusion: Radar emits radio waves with emission lasting 1μs and interval of 100μs between emissions.
Sharp waves displayed on indicator's fluorescent screen as shown in the figure.
ab = bc in the figure and speed of light in vacuum is c=3.0×10^8 m/s.
Image depicts radar emitting radio waves with three sharp waves visible on a screen and horizontal line labeled with points a, b, and c.
Radar emits radio waves with pulse lasting 1μs and interval of 100μs, total time for one emission and next is 101μs.
Using formula distance = speed × time, calculate distance as 3.0 × 10^8 m/s × 101 × 10^-9 s = 303 m.
Symmetry implies total distance is twice calculated distance, so total distance = 2 × 303 m = 606 m.
